data.event: The town of San Fernando was established in 1636 as Visita de Cauit in what is today Barangay Azagra.
In 1744, Cajiodiocan was turned into a pueblo (town) which included Visita de Cauit.

event.title: was made a separate district in 1853

data.event: After Romblon was made a separate district in 1853, and the local government reorganization of 1855, 17 new pueblos were created including Visita de Cauit.
After Romblon was made a separate district in 1853, and the local government reorganization of 1855, 17 new pueblos were created including Visita de Cauit.

event.title: 3 February 1868, Pueblo de Cauit was renamed

data.event: On 3 February 1868, Pueblo de Cauit was renamed Pueblo de Azagra.

event.title: was renamed Visita de San Fernando in 1882

data.event: One of Azagra's villages, Visita de Pag-alad was renamed Visita de San Fernando in 1882, in honor of Ferdinand Magellan.

event.title: was introduced to the province by the Americans on 16 March 1901

data.event: When civilian government was introduced to the province by the Americans on 16 March 1901, Azagra was one of 11 new municipalities created.

event.title: the end of the year, the seat of the municipality was transferred

data.event: However, by the end of the year, the seat of the municipality was transferred from Azagra to San Fernando village, thereby, changing the town's name.
